intro: Monotes duvigneaudii var. concolor, commonly known as the smooth monotes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
